intro: Cupania crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved cupania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Cupania crassifolia is valued for its ornamental potential and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
